column9: Creatures gain a +5 bonus with Sleight of Hand checks to hide a Hand Crossbow on their body.

A repeating crossbow uses a clip that holds 5 bolts allowing you to fire the crossbow without having to reload it after each shot. It takes 6AP to eject and insert a new clip of 5 bolts into the repeating crossbow.
A creature hit by a bola is knocked prone in its space.
A greatspear cannot be used to attack adjacent creatures.

A garrote always requires 2 hands to use. You cannot attack creatures more than one size larger or smaller than you with a garrote. With a successful attack you have the attacked creature grabbed. The escape target# is the status target# of your status with Unique Light Weapons.
A lashknife is length of chain with a small blade on one end and a handle on the other. A lashknife can be rolled up and effectively sheathed.
A whip can be rolled up and effectively sheathed.

A successful attack with a net ensnares an opponent. The ensnared creature can cut themselves free with any weapon with a blade for 10 AP or a successful Escaping check (10 AP target# determined by the status of the attacking creature's status in Unique Ranged Weapons).
